publisher.value: Health Level Seven International (Modeling and Methodology)

description.value: A numeric value that allows the comparison (less than, greater than) or other numerical manipulation of a concept (e.g. Adding up components of a score).

short.value: Numerical value associated with the concept (for comparison and scoring)

definition.value: A numeric value that allows the comparison (less than, greater than) or other numerical manipulation of a concept (e.g. Adding up components of a score).

comment.value: This extension assigns a numerical value to a concept. Assigning a value to a concept should generally be done in a formal code system that defines the value, or in an applicable value set for the concept, but some concepts do not have a formal definition (or are not even represented as a concept formally - often in Questionnaires), so this extension is allowed to appear ouside those preferred contexts. The value may be constrained to an integer in some contexts of use.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

definition.value: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

description.value: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

short.value: identifies the meaning of the extension

definition.value: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.

comment.value: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.

definition.value: Value of extension - may be a resource or one of a constrained set of the data types (see Extensibility in the spec for list).

short.value: Numerical value associated with the concept (for comparison and scoring)

definition.value: A numeric value that allows the comparison (less than, greater than) or other numerical manipulation of a concept (e.g. Adding up components of a score).

comment.value: This extension assigns a numerical value to a concept. Assigning a value to a concept should generally be done in a formal code system that defines the value, or in an applicable value set for the concept, but some concepts do not have a formal definition (or are not even represented as a concept formally - often in Questionnaires), so this extension is allowed to appear ouside those preferred contexts. The value may be constrained to an integer in some contexts of use.
